channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Key Questions From Conservative Justices in the Tariffs Case
item.description: A lively argument spanning almost three hours featured illuminating exchanges that tested the usual commitments of some of the justices on the right s...

item.title: What Travelers Need to Know About the Shutdown, Flight Reductions and Delays
item.description: As the government shutdown continues, more challenges await passengers as they deal with the newest announcement from the Trump administration: a 10 p...

item.title: Supreme Court Clears Way for Trump Transgender Passport Policy
item.description: A lower court judge had temporarily blocked the administration’s policy requiring that passports reflect sex as found on an original birth certificate...

item.title: Zohran Mamdani is New York’s first millennial Mayor—experts share how the young leader’s style will differ from his boomer predecessors
item.description: Higher minimum wage for young workers, remote working and a 4-day workweek could get a spotlight thanks to New York’s first millennial Mayor

item.title: Mamdani Allies Create a Nonprofit to Push His Affordability Agenda
item.description: A new group will solicit donations to replicate Zohran Mamdani’s grass-roots army of volunteers and to help build momentum for his proposals.

item.title: Nancy Pelosi retires from legendary career as Obama hails ‘one of the best speakers the House of Representatives has ever had’
item.description: “I will not be seeking reelection to Congress,” Pelosi said in a video address to voters.

item.title: Jamie Dimon predicts AI will shorten the workweek: ‘My guess is the developed world be working three-and-a-half days a week’
item.description: He thinks it’ll eliminate jobs, but we can steer our way out of disaster.

item.title: Trump Announces Deal to Drop Obesity Drug Prices to as Little as $149 a Month
item.description: President Trump announced a deal with Eli Lilly and Novo Nordisk to lower prices on hugely popular weight-loss drugs for Medicare, Medicaid and Americ...

item.title: Boeing won’t face a criminal conspiracy charge over two 737 Max jetliner crashes that killed 346 people
item.description: As part of a deal to drop the charge, the American aerospace company has agreed to pay or invest an additional $1.1 billion in fines.

item.title: Tests showing Chinese-made buses can be stopped remotely prompt Norwegian pullback
item.description: The company said tests, done in underground mines to block signals, used both new Yutong buses and three-year-old models from Dutch maker VDL.

item.title: Ed Moloney, Chronicler of the Troubles in Northern Ireland, Dies at 77
item.description: He wrote a history of the Irish Republican Army and directed a project that secretly collected oral histories of paramilitary fighters.

item.title: COP30 Begins With U.S. Allies and Rivals Alike Calling for Action
item.description: The calls for action on opening day stood in sharp contrast to the position of the President Trump, who has called global warming a “con job.”

item.title: Paramilitary Group in Sudan Agrees to Cease-Fire Proposal
item.description: The paramilitary group Rapid Support Forces agreed to a cease-fire proposal after growing condemnation of atrocities in Darfur. Sudan’s military reite...

item.title: Iran Sentences Iranian American Jewish Man to Prison, Family Says
item.description: Kamran Hekmati of Long Island was arrested for visiting Israel 13 years ago to celebrate his son’s bar mitzvah, they said.

item.title: Paramilitary Accepts Sudan Truce Plan, but the Military Has Not
item.description: The R.S.F. paramilitary group, facing growing condemnation for atrocities in Darfur, said it had agreed to a cease-fire proposal, but it is not yet cl...
